page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our block is in North Shropshire but about one third of it is in Wales. The Shropshire Union Canal is a major feature. It runs right through our block. In the east is the beginning of low lying land known as "The Mosses", one end is Wem Moss and the other end is in Wales, Cadney Moss. There are very main roads but a honeycomb of country lanes and minor roads. Four hamlets or villages make up our block: Lyneal, Welshampton, Northwood and Bettisfield. In Lyneal there is an avenue of trees which dates back to the 1870's and was planted by the lady who built the church. In Lyneal, we have a caravan site and with the Shropshire Union Canal our block gets alot of tourists.
